content: second sock using a separate ball of wool round one knit in the round for both socks ensuring you use the right ball of wool for each sock round two k1 kfb knit to last two stitches kfb k1 this will increase 2 stitched on each side of the sock = 4 per sock repeat this pattern knitting one row followed by the increase row until you have 30 stitches for each side of the sock = 60 stitches in total per sock now continue to knit every row until the foot reaches the centre of your ankle bone when you try it on or is two inches shorter than the total required foot length short row heel click here to watch the video tutorial until now we have been knitting both socks at the same time now you will complete the heel on the first sock before doing the heel on the second sock so you are only working on one sock at a time while knitting the heels stitch markers these help divide the stitches into three but are not essential row 1 knit 10 stitches and place a stitch marker knit 10 more and place a second marker knit until you have just one remaining stitch on the left needle bring the yarn forward to the front of your work now slip this stitch to the right needle and turn your work as you bring your yarn around it will wrap behind this stitch this is called wrap and turn 2 row 2 slip the wrapped stitch to the right needle purl until you have one stitch left on the left needle bring the yarn to the front of the work through the gap between the stitches move the final stitch to the right needle turn your work as you bring the yarn around it will wrap this stitch row 3 slip the wrapped stitch to the right needle knit until the stitch before your first wrapped stitch at the end of this row wrap that stitch turn row 4 slip the wrapped stitch to the right needle you should now have two wrapped stitches on the right needle purl until the stitch before your first wrapped stitch at the end of this row wrap that stitch turn you repeat this process for another 16 row until you have wrapped all 10 stitches either side of the stitch markers row 21 knit across the 10 middle stitches to the first wrapped stitch next to the left stitch marker pick up the wrap loop and knit this with the stitch wrap the next stitch and turn this stitch will now be double wrapped row 22 slip the first stitch purl across the middle stitches to the first wrapped stich by the other stitch marker pick up the wrap and purl it together with the stitch wrap the next stitch and turn row 23 slip the first stitch knit back across your work to your double wrapped stitch pick
